website_summaries.verdict: The Philips Brilliance LCD Monitor with Nvidia G-Sync (272G5DYEB) is a 27-inch gaming monitor that's limited to a 1,920-by-1,080 resolution, but it still delivers smooth, stutter-free performance.
pros: Speedy refresh and pixel response rates

customer_reviews.title: Great but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome monitor. I really really like this monitor. Gsync and 144hz (120hz with 3d) Is absolutely insane. My two complaints are that it only has a single display port input, so if that port dies your screwed. My second complaint is the power brick is proprietary. So if that breaks your also screwed. Please make the next model with more then one input (DP + HDMI please - mostly for console hookups) and a standard power cable. Everything else is superb. Good stand. Amazing picture.
customer_reviews.author: Irvine5000

customer_reviews.title: but as an avid gamer with a severe dislike of screen-tearing I am in love with this monitor
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure how many people will appreciate this technology, but as an avid gamer with a severe dislike of screen-tearing I am in love with this monitor. I could not be happier with this purchase, and I will be recommending G-sync over 4k for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Very good monitor for 3d...
customer_reviews.text: ...at a time when 3d has pretty much gone by the way of horse and carriage. Why is beyond my understanding but most likely because of the fragmented market of 3d and the lack of compatibility between systems. Every component must be on the same tech and that rarely happens across 4 or 5 requirements needed just to get there. Anyhow I had the right equipment except the monitor. It works. Delivery was super fast. Arrived days earlier than noted in the tracking. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: david carswell

customer_reviews.title: Issue with first, but replacement fine so far.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great monitor, g-sync works great, size is nice. My issue is that my first one would not output a picture after a week or so... The product manual said that it might be in some sleep mode but there was not fix given by them. Luckily, Amazon gave me a free exchange for a new one and that one has had no issue so far, but the possibility is still there.
customer_reviews.author: ISmith

customer_reviews.title: Solid G-sync monitor overall
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid G-sync monitor overall, and ideal for perhaps an older gamer who needs a little help reading text while not gaming. The only drawback for me was that I'm not fond of the "no-button" power on/off feature. Putting your thumb/finger sometimes powers it on/off without issue, and at other times you have to do it a couple of times to get it to work. I'd much prefer just a button.
customer_reviews.author: @myersbradley

customer_reviews.title: Great 144hz 1080p Monitor
customer_reviews.text: I have had this monitor for at least 6 months now and it has treated me very well. It powered on without issue and had no scratches, dings, or any damage. There were no dead pixels or problems with light bleed. G-SYNC on this monitor works amazing and makes every game look butter smooth even with frame drops. I would highly recommend this monitor to anyone looking for 1080p gaming at high framerates.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Ehler

customer_reviews.title: Great product beautiful picture.
customer_reviews.text: This monitor looks amazing. I've had it for near a year now and still love using it. If i could do it again i'd go smaller just because 27 in is a bit big for gaming IMO. The only frown I have occurs when looking at a normal monitor.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: But the product is very good despite of TN panel used
customer_reviews.text: This is second item I received by the defective of first one. But the product is very good despite of TN panel used. Color expression, response speed, G-Sync functions all are impressed me. Also there was no death pixel at all in both of fisrt defective one and second too. I think Philips is superior display manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Youngkeun Kim

customer_reviews.title: For $200 more you go to the next level but if you want a great monitor, 27" at about $500 you can can't ...
customer_reviews.text: I consider myself an avid gamer. This is a solid gaming monitor and presents colors and black fantastically. For $200 more you go to the next level but if you want a great monitor, 27" at about $500 you can can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: oktarb

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent screen all the way around except the lack of physical buttons on the panel. The bright blue (and completely idiotic) "PHILIPS" logo that goes fullscreen whenever turning the monitor on is very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: WiseMan

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor!
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor, plays games in stunning affects, 3D is awesome. Other people mention pixelating on pitchers and video, but I only found that problem to be on low res items, anything with high res had no pixelating issues, anything high res looks awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Cowboy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor for high FPS gaming. If you're on team green, consider this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Montano A Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Gaming/3D Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Have had this a couple months now. Really great so far. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: T. J.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Was a very nice monitor but I am into 4k and this is not
customer_reviews.author: Jaime S.

customer_reviews.title: Worthy!
customer_reviews.text: Solid. The stand is excellent. G-Sync was a little frustrating to get working. Make sure you update the drivers from the Phillips web site, NOT the included disks. Then run Nvidia control panel and make sure it's turned on there either globally or for the games you want it to function on. Works on the DP 1.1a cable I had (8 foot) so the 1.2 port does not require a cable advertised as 1.2, test what you have before buying an upgrade. It comes with a 6' DP cable, but I need 8' to avoid strain when shifting the monitor. Crisp and smooth. 11/4/14 edit to clarify DP cable.
customer_reviews.author: C. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Very good monitor
customer_reviews.text: Overall an awesome monitor especially with my geoforce 970 SLI cards.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome monitor so far
customer_reviews.text: Awesome monitor so far. I'll never be going back to a 60hz monitor. Pixels don't look big to me at 1080 as opposed to higher resolution. The color is a little bit off, I'll have to mess around with the settings.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Lau

customer_reviews.title: Bro, do you even G-Sync?
customer_reviews.text: G-Sync. 'Nuff said. If you're on the fence, buy one. Having a variable refresh rate is something that should be coveted by all. Though this will benefit those with weaker systems that have trouble holding a high FPS, this monitor will improve every gaming experience, hands down. Click buy it now, and thank me later.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew T. Wanca

customer_reviews.title: good but no hdmi and it's flicker when electrostatic move ...
customer_reviews.text: good but no hdmi and it's flicker when electrostatic move arround the screen like clothes or iron use near screen
customer_reviews.author: mohammed aldiab

customer_reviews.title: best monitor iv bought for gaming and office use the ...
customer_reviews.text: best monitor iv bought for gaming and office use the 144hz really is amazing and the 1080p is eye candy the lighting was perfect on the monitor right out of the box and i really like that it comes with a swivel base mount i would recommend this monitor to anyone that is pc master race
customer_reviews.author: shane selander

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor!
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor!, color wonderful, New G-Sync for gamers by Nvidia, and you need Nvidia card to take advantage from G-Sync, if you don't care that much of 4K monitors and you need fast, clear and framerate good for games this monitor for you.
customer_reviews.author: ALI Z. Agel

customer_reviews.title: Good, buuuttt
customer_reviews.text: Amazeballs, buuttt the bezels are ginormous. Looks like an old flat panel TV in that respect. Also, it has all the problems of a TN panel. Really bad color at an angle
customer_reviews.author: PC Master

customer_reviews.title: I enabled DSR on my Nvidia card to enable 4k and I could be happier.
customer_reviews.text: Gsync is the truth. I enabled DSR on my Nvidia card to enable 4k and I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Silvester Reynoso

customer_reviews.title: The resolution is low 1080p compared to other UHD monitors ...
customer_reviews.text: The resolution is low 1080p compared to other UHD monitors. Also, more inputs on monitor are need to make it more versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Philips 272G5DYEB 27-Inch G-Sync Ultimate Performance Gaming Monitor 144hz, 1MS, 3D Ready
product_meta.description: Dominate the competition like never before. The Philips 27" 272G5DYEB gaming monitor with NVIDIA G-SYNC technology eliminates tearing and stuttering providing the smoothest and fastest gaming experience ever.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars46 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
